benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/children - List children accounts

covered: Valid Request: Multiple scenarios (TC01-TC06, TC19, TC20) verify successful retrieval for valid parent accountId and combinations of query parameters including balances and audit levels.
Empty Response: TC07 and TC24 cover parent accounts with no children and the case where children were deleted, ensuring empty-array behavior is validated.
Query Parameters: Positive and negative cases covered: valid combinations (TC06), malformed values (TC16), unexpected extra parameters (TC13), and regression for balance-related behavior (TC19).
Authorization: Both unauthenticated (TC11) and insufficient-permission (TC12) cases are covered.
Error Handling for Resource Existence and Format: Invalid UUID format (TC09), non-existent parent (TC10 and TC08), and missing path parameter (TC25) are present.
Service/Dependency Errors & Timeouts: System dependency unavailable (TC14) and backend delay/timeout (TC18) are included.
Security/Input Validation: Injection attempt via accountId is covered (TC17).
Performance / Large Volume: TC15 addresses a very large payload scenario and performance expectation.
Concurrency & Integration: Concurrent access (TC21) and audit-service integration consistency (TC22) are included.
gaps: Pagination: There are no tests that validate pagination semantics (offset/limit or page tokens), boundary conditions, or default pagination behavior despite a large-data scenario being present (TC15 does not assert or explore pagination).
Caching Behavior / HTTP Caching Headers: No scenarios check ETag, Last-Modified, Cache-Control, or conditional GET semantics (304 handling).
Rate Limiting / Throttling: No tests exercise rate limiting / burst request handling or the system behavior under throttling (429 responses).
Response Headers and Content-Type: Tests do not assert presence/correctness of response headers (Content-Type, pagination-related headers, or caching headers).

Pagination-related performance & partial-result behaviors: When result sets are huge, there are no tests for streaming, partial responses, or server-side limits (e.g., max page size), or how the API behaves when asked for pages beyond available range.
Internationalization / Encoding: No tests for non-ASCII characters in account fields (names/metadata) or verifying correct encoding in responses.

Negative combinations of query params: There is coverage for some malformed params and combinations, but not exhaustive negative interaction tests (e.g., accountWithBalance=true combined with accountWithBalanceAndCBA=true conflict detection or precedence rules if any).
Caching + Authorization interactions: No tests for cache behavior with auth-required endpoints (e.g., ensuring sensitive data isn’t cached improperly).
recommendations: Add explicit pagination tests: verify offset/limit or page token semantics, default page size, boundary conditions (first/last/empty pages), and behavior when requesting beyond available pages. Include assertions on any pagination headers or links.

Add caching behavior tests: assert Cache-Control and ETag/Last-Modified headers on responses, test conditional GETs resulting in 304, and ensure caching does not expose sensitive data for authenticated endpoints.
Add rate-limiting tests: simulate high request rates to assert 429 responses and verify retry-after headers or backoff behavior.
Add response header checks: include Content-Type, any pagination headers (e.g., X-Total-Count), and security headers (e.g., Cache-Control: no-store when appropriate).

Expand query-parameter negative/interaction tests: include conflicting/ambiguous combinations (both balance flags true/false permutations if business rules dictate precedence), and test boundary values for enum audit parameter (case sensitivity, unsupported values).
Add encoding/I18N tests: verify responses when account names/metadata contain non-ASCII characters and ensure UTF-8 correctness.
Add caching + auth interaction tests: ensure authenticated responses aren’t incorrectly cached in shared caches and that conditional requests respect authentication/authorization.

Clarify and expand TC15 into pagination + performance: either assert that large results are paginated or that the system supports bulk retrieval within performance SLAs; if pagination is required, update TC15 to validate retrieving all pages and aggregate results.
